alert.note: Alert for Broward; Palm Beach (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 03 at 8:34AM EDT until August 05 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Florida, including the following counties, Broward and Palm Beach. * WHEN...Until 1030 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 832 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to slow moving heavy rain showers. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen from these slowly moving heavy rain showers. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area during the next couple of hours with these slow moving heavy rain showers. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Coral Springs, Pompano Beach, Boca Raton, Deerfield Beach, Lighthouse Point, Coconut Creek, Parkland, Hillsboro Beach, Boca Pointe, Boca Del Mar, Hamptons At Boca Raton, Godfrey Road, Mission Bay, Whisper Walk, Loxahatchee NWR, Hillsboro Ranches, Sandalfoot Cove, Hillsboro Pines and South County Regional Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
